trans-unit.source: Setting Timeouts for File Service Operations
trans-unit.target: Setting Timeouts for File Service Operations

trans-unit.source: A call to a File service API can include a server timeout interval, specified in the <codeInline>timeout</codeInline> parameter of the request URI.
trans-unit.target: A call to a File service API can include a server timeout interval, specified in the <codeInline>timeout</codeInline> parameter of the request URI.

trans-unit.source: If the server timeout interval elapses before the service has finished processing the request, the service returns an error.
trans-unit.target: If the server timeout interval elapses before the service has finished processing the request, the service returns an error.

trans-unit.source: The maximum timeout interval for File service operations is 30 seconds.
trans-unit.target: The maximum timeout interval for File service operations is 30 seconds.

trans-unit.source: The File service automatically reduces any timeouts larger than 30 seconds to the 30-second maximum.
trans-unit.target: The File service automatically reduces any timeouts larger than 30 seconds to the 30-second maximum.

trans-unit.source: The following example REST URI sets the timeout interval for the <link xlink:href="e731d02f-4447-4d91-8228-b233e8a28c1d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">List Shares</link> operation to 20 seconds:
trans-unit.target: The following example REST URI sets the timeout interval for the <link xlink:href="e731d02f-4447-4d91-8228-b233e8a28c1d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">List Shares</link> operation to 20 seconds:
